attributes.action: Prevent Staffordshire County Council from completing proposed closure of their Residential Homes and EMI Daycentres
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As part of the 'Changing Lives' reform, Staffordshire County Council is closing all of their residential homes and Elderly Mentally Infirm (EMI) daycentres.

The timescales are alarming. The council want to shut the facilities within a year irrespective of whether or not there is a good quality, local replacement.

Private sector alternatives are given to the lowest bidder who will still be expecting to turn a profit. Consequently, the level of care drops.

Moving residents against their will is highly stressful and can be directly responsible for death.

The EMI daycentre care enables many people to maintain independence and to live at home. Closing them would mean that more people would rely on non-professional carers or have to move into a residential home (which is contrary to the 'Changing Lives' goal).

This petition urges the Prime Minister to reverse the decision to close the services in Staffordshire.
